intro: Cohniella croatii, commonly known as the Croatian cohniella, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Croatia. It belongs to the family Cohniellaceae and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including small, clustered leaves and distinct floral structures. The plant thrives in nutrient-poor, calcareous soils, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Its conservation status is vulnerable due to habitat degradation and limited distribution. Botanists study Cohniella croatii to better understand its ecological role and potential for conservation efforts.
